Berri launches "reformist revolution"
06 Nov 2019, 07:52 by Lebanon 24
Speaker Nabih Berri assured his visitors yesterday: "The priority now is to speed up the formation of the government. The situation does not bear any delay, and the longer we delay the greater the danger to the country. The issue does not bear lengthy, I do not say months, but weeks, if no government is formed We were in a very politically difficult situation in 2005 after the assassination of Prime Minister Rafic Hariri, the economic situation was not as bad as it is now, and yet this ordeal has been overcome. Berri stressed that the parliament is facing a major task He saw next week, through the election of his parliamentary committees, as well as through a legislative session to approve a set of reform laws, most of which come in response to what the movement demanded. "In response to a question, Berri said:" I am with the movement and his demands, but I am never with banditry and insults Referring to a government of 24 ministers, Berri said: "All that is said about government formulas is baseless." Berri announced after the meeting of the Parliamentary Bureau that he would call a legislative session after Tuesday's session. Next, to complete the Bureau of the Council and the members of committees, will put on its agenda the following laws: a First: Decree 5272 on the Anti-Corruption Law. Second: Proposal of the Law on the Establishment of a Court for Financial Crimes. Third: Decree 4303 Law on Guarantee of Aging. 1. Bank secrecy lifted. 2. Money laundering. 3. Recovery of looted funds.
